input.description: adapter name [Optional] The name of the adapter that is enabled on the Peer. The default adapter name is HPSEActor

1. Lists the organizations available in the management server. Sample Request XML:
<items> <item> <command>list</command> <category>security</category> <process-id>find-organization-details</process-id> <command-arguments> <organization> <all/> </organization> </command-arguments> </item> </items>
Parameters Description:
command[Required] The actual command type that will be executed. category[Required] This parameter identifies the top-level functional category. process-id[Required] Unique identifier for the process workflow. organization[Required] Indicates that an organization is being searched here. all[Required] Indicates that details of all organizations are being searched here.
2. Provides information about the organization specified. Sample Request XML:
<items> <item> <command>list</command> <category>security</category> <process-id>find-organization-details</process-id> <command-arguments> <organization> <organization-id>1029</organization-id> </organization> </command-arguments> </item> </items>
Parameters Description:
command[Required] The actual command type that will be executed. category[Required] This parameter identifies the top-level functional category. process-id[Required] Unique identifier for the process workflow. organization[Required] Indicates that an organization is being searched here. organization-id[Required] id of the organization that is being searched here.
3. Lists elements available in the organization specified. Sample Request XML:
<items> <item> <command>list</command> <category>security</category> <process-id>find-organization-details</process-id> <command-arguments> <organization> <element/> <organization-id>1029</organization-id> </organization> </command-arguments> </item> </items>
Parameters Description:
command[Required] The actual command type that will be executed. category[Required] This parameter identifies the top-level functional category. process-id[Required] Unique identifier for the process workflow. organization[Required] Indicates that an organization is being searched here. organization-id[Required] id of the organization that is being searched here. element[Required] Indicates the details of elements present in the organization is requested.
4. Lists users available in the organization specified. Sample Request XML:
<items> <item> <command>list</command> <category>security</category> <process-id>find-organization-details</process-id> <command-arguments> <organization> <user/> <organization-id>1029</organization-id> </organization> </command-arguments> </item> </items>
Parameters Description:
command[Required] The actual command type that will be executed. category[Required] This parameter identifies the top-level functional category. process-id[Required] Unique identifier for the process workflow. organization[Required] Indicates that an organization is being searched here. organization-id[Required] id of the organization that is being searched here. user[Required] Indicates the details of users present in the organization is requested.
5. Lists child organizations in the organization specified. Sample Request XML:
<items> <item> <command>list</command> <category>security</category> <process-id>find-organization-details</process-id> <command-arguments> <organization> <childorganization/> <organization-id>1029</organization-id> </organization> </command-arguments> </item> </items>
Parameters Description:
command[Required] The actual command type that will be executed. category[Required] This parameter identifies the top-level functional category. process-id[Required] Unique identifier for the process workflow. organization[Required] Indicates that an organization is being searched here. organization-id[Required] id of the organization that is being searched here. childorganization[Required] Indicates the details of childorganizations present in the organization is requested.
6. Provides a detailed description of the organizations available in the management server. Sample Request XML:
<items> <item> <command>show</command> <category>security</category> <process-id>find-organization-details</process-id> <command-arguments> <organization> <all/> </organization> </command-arguments> </item> </items>
Parameters Description:
command[Required] The actual command type that will be executed. category[Required] This parameter identifies the top-level functional category. process-id[Required] Unique identifier for the process workflow. organization[Required] Indicates that an organization is being searched here. all[Required] Indicates that details of all organizations are being searched here.
7. Provides a detailed information about the organization specified. Sample Request XML:
<items> <item> <command>show</command> <category>security</category> <process-id>find-organization-details</process-id> <command-arguments> <organization> <organization-id>1029</organization-id> </organization> </command-arguments> </item> </items>
Parameters Description:
command[Required] The actual command type that will be executed. category[Required] This parameter identifies the top-level functional category. process-id[Required] Unique identifier for the process workflow. organization[Required] Indicates that an organization is being searched here. organization-id[Required] id of the organization that is being searched here.
8. Provides a detailed description of the elements available in the organization specified. Sample Request XML:
<items> <item> <command>show</command> <category>security</category> <process-id>find-organization-details</process-id> <command-arguments> <organization> <element/> <organization-id>1029</organization-id> </organization> </command-arguments> </item> </items>
Parameters Description:
command[Required] The actual command type that will be executed. category[Required] This parameter identifies the top-level functional category. process-id[Required] Unique identifier for the process workflow. organization[Required] Indicates that an organization is being searched here. organization-id[Required] id of the organization that is being searched here. element[Required] Indicates the details of elements present in the organization is requested.
9. Provides a detailed description of the users available in the organization specified. Sample Request XML:
<items> <item> <command>show</command> <category>security</category> <process-id>find-organization-details</process-id> <command-arguments> <organization> <user/> <organization-id>1029</organization-id> </organization> </command-arguments> </item> </items>
Parameters Description:
command[Required] The actual command type that will be executed. category[Required] This parameter identifies the top-level functional category. process-id[Required] Unique identifier for the process workflow. organization[Required] Indicates that an organization is being searched here. organization-id[Required] id of the organization that is being searched here. user[Required] Indicates the details of users present in the organization is requested.
10. Provides a detailed description of the child organizations in the organization specified. Sample Request XML:
<items> <item> <command>show</command> <category>security</category> <process-id>find-organization-details</process-id> <command-arguments> <organization> <childorganization/> <organization-id>1029</organization-id> </organization> </command-arguments> </item> </items>
Parameters Description:
command[Required] The actual command type that will be executed. category[Required] This parameter identifies the top-level functional category. process-id[Required] Unique identifier for the process workflow. organization[Required] Indicates that an organization is being searched here. organization-id[Required] id of the organization that is being searched here. childorganization[Required] Indicates the details of childorganizations present in the organization is requested.

documentation.description:
This wrapper supports the following requirements:-
1. Lists the organizations available in the management server. 2. Provides information about the organization specified. 3. Lists elements available in the organization specified. 4. Lists users in the organization specified. 5. Lists child organizations in the organization specified. 6. Provides a detailed description of the organizations available in the management server. 7. Provides a detailed description of the organization specified. 8. Provides a detailed description of all the elements available in the organization specified. 9. Provides a detailed description of all the users in the organization specified. 10. Provides a detailed description of all the child organizations in the organization specified.
